business.headline: Google layoffs: Over 100 design jobs cut in AI shiftGoogle has also been cutting back on management layers. According to reports, the company has reduced the number of middle managers by more than a third, particularly those overseeing small teams.

Market holiday: Are NSE, BSE open on Gandhi Jayanti, Dussehra on October 2?Sensex and Nifty gained nearly 1% in the last session after the Reserve Bank of India (RBI) kept the repo rate unchanged at 5.5% and maintained its neutral stance.

Satya Nadella bets big on AI, names Judson Althoff to lead Microsoft commercial unitMicrosoft has elevated Chief Commercial Officer Judson Althoff as CEO of its commercial business, allowing Satya Nadella to focus on AI, datacenter buildout, and product innovation.
Why the price of gold keeps breaking recordsBullion has soared more than 45% this year, putting it on track for the biggest annual gain since 1979.

Adar Poonawalla in talks to buy RCB stake? United Spirits shares updateThe CEO of Serum Institute, Adar Poonawalla, is in talks with Diageo to purchase a stake in RCB, one of the Indian Premier League's top teams.
Are festive cheer and auto stocks driving the market rally?The stock market showed renewed strength, as festive season cheer and gains in auto stocks lifted investor sentiment across sectors.

DA hiked to 58%: What it means for government employees' salary and pensionThe Union Cabinet approved the proposal to increase the DA for central government employees and Dearness Relief (DR) for pensioners by 3%. With this revision, the DA rate now stands at 58%.
Sensex ends 716 points higher, Nifty above 24,800; Tata Motors up 5%The S&P BSE Sensex jumped 715.64 points to end at 80,983.31, while the NSE Nifty50 added 225.20 points to close at 24,836.30.

This Indian gold lender holds 3 times the gold of PakistanThe country's largest gold loan provider, currently holds 209 tonnes of gold in its safe deposit boxes. This is three times the gold reserves of Pakistan and higher than the reserves of Brazil, Australia, and South Africa.

Shah Rukh Khan joins billionaire club, Mukesh Ambani tops Hurun India Rich ListMukesh Ambani has reclaimed the top spot on the Hurun India Rich List 2025, while Bollywood superstar Shah Rukh Khan joins the billionaire club for the first time.

Sensex jumps 500 points: 3 reasons why markets are rising todayThe S&P BSE Sensex surged 660.64 points to 80,928.26, while the NSE Nifty50 rose 185.70 points to 24,796.80 as of 12:10 PM. The rally was broad-based on Dalal Street.

Union Cabinet approves 3% DA hike for central government employeesEarlier this year, the government had approved a 2% increase in DA in March, raising it from 53% to 55% of the basic salary and pension.

entertainment.headline: Alia Bhatt pulled by fan for selfie at Durga Puja pandal, handles it calmly. Video Alia Bhatt handled a brief fan encounter with grace during her visit to the star-studded Durga Puja pandal in Mumbai. She posed for a photo and calmly ensured her security team didn't escalate the situation.

Cruel elite women: Karan hits back at Anusha's cheating claims in now-deleted post Anusha Dandekar reignited her feud with ex-boyfriend Karan Kundrra by hinting on her podcast that he cheated on her, saying he was "sleeping with all of Mumbai." Karan hit back with a now-deleted Instagram note, accusing "elite women with Bollywood connections" of harassment and mental badgering.

Classical singer Pandit Chhannulal Mishra dies at 89 Pandit Chhannulal Mishra, acclaimed Hindustani classical singer, died early Thursday in Mirzapur. He was 89 years old. Prime Minister Narendra Modi paid his last respects to the late singer on social media.

Lost a true hero: Leonardo DiCaprio pays tribute to primatologist Jane Goodall Leonardo DiCaprio paid an emotional tribute to legendary primatologist Jane Goodall, who died at 91, calling her "a true hero for the planet." The two shared a long friendship rooted in their passion for conservation and environmental advocacy.

Kantara Chapter 1 X reviews: Fans call Rishab Shetty film a divine roar 'Kantara: Chapter 1' has received spectacular reviews on X, with fans praising Rishab Shetty's masterful storytelling and immersive cinematic experience. The film has created a 'divine roar' among audiences, resonating deeply with cultural pride and raising high expectations for its success in Indian cinema.

Sunny Sanskari Ki review: Varun leads a shaky front in this lukewarm rom-comRelease Date:Thu Oct 02, 2025 Sunny Sanskari Ki Tulsi Kumari movie review: Varun Dhawan and Shashank Khaitan reunite for 'Sunny Sanskari Ki Tulsi Kumari', a rom-com mixing classic Bollywood style with modern humour. The film entertains with witty dialogues but stumbles with a rushed climax and awkward scenes, says our review.

Kantara Chapter 1 review: Rishab Shetty's folklore saga is a spellbinding spectacle Live UpdatesRelease Date:Thu Oct 02, 2025 Kantara Chapter 1 movie review: Director, writer, and actor Rishab Shetty's film, also starring Rukmini Vasanth and Jayaram, explores the man vs nature conflict and land rights, blending them with divinity, folklore, myth, and faith. The film is a brilliant cinematic showcase.

Hrithik Roshan shares vacation photos with partner Saba Azad on fourth anniversary Actor Hrithik Roshan marked his fourth anniversary with partner Saba Azad by sharing heartfelt note and vacation pictures. The post sparked warm reactions on social media, highlighting the couple's affectionate bond.

Frankenstein trailer: Creature Jacob Elordi unleashes rage on creator Oscar Issac The trailer of director Guillermo del Toro's 'Frankenstein' was released by Netflix on October 1, 2025. The film features Oscar Isaac and Jacob Elordi and reimagines Mary Shelley's classic tale with a modern twist.

Priya Marathe's husband Shantanu shares heartfelt note a month after her death Actor Shantanu Moghe posted an emotional message marking a month since Priya Marathe's death. Priya Marathe, known for 'Pavitra Rishta', died after battling cancer.

Allu Arjun's brother Allu Sirish announces engagement to Nayanika in October Actor Allu Sirish announced his engagement to Nayanika on October 1, the birth anniversary of his grandfather, actor Allu Ramalingaiah. His brother Allu Arjun, shared a congratulatory post on social media.

Which Marvel actor stars in Jason Statham's The Beekeeper 2? Find out here Apart from new additions to the cast, Jason Statham's The Beekeeper 2 will bring back Jeremy Irons, Jemma Redgrave and Emmy Raver-Lampman in familiar roles from the first film

Sunny Sanskari vs Kantara Chapter 1: Varun-Janhvi film trails in advance booking 'Sunny Sanskari Ki Tulsi Kumari' is set for a Rs 2 crore opening. The film faces stiff competition from actor-director Rishab Shetty's 'Kantara: Chapter 1' at the box office.

Bigg Boss 19 leads OTT non-fiction with 7.5 million weekly views 'Bigg Boss 19', hosted by Salman Khan, became the most watched reality show on OTT for the week of September 22-28, 2025, with 7.5 million views. The second most-watched on the list was 'Rise & Fall'.

KBC 17: Contestant quits at Rs 1 crore question, can you answer it? Kaun Banega Crorepati 17 contestant Kailash Rambhau Kuntewad won Rs 50 lakh after quitting the Rs 1 crore question on Amitabh Bachchan's quiz show.

13th review: Kota Factory déjà vu with a twist of corporate dramaRelease Date:Wed Oct 01, 2025 Beyond Kota's grind and IIT's glory, SonyLiv's latest series '13th: Some Lessons Aren't Taught in Classrooms' celebrates mentorship, integrity, and the power of learning that outlives any test.

They Call Him OG: Pawan Kalyan's film adds a new Neha Shetty dance track Neha Shetty's dance track 'Kiss Kiss Bang Bang' has been added to 'They Call Him OG' from Tuesday evening shows. The move aims to boost theatre footfall during Dasara after ticket price normalisation.

Explained: Taj Mahal controversy reignited by The Taj Story poster row Taj Mahal's origins spark fresh debate after Paresh Rawal's 'The Taj Story' poster depicts a Shiva idol inside the monument. Here's why the poster is raising storm.

Song Kang completes military service, to star in musical drama Four Hands South Korean actor Song Kang was discharged from military service on October 1, 2025. He is reviewing an offer for the lead in the upcoming drama 'Four Hands'.

general news.headline: Dependence musn't turn into compulsion: RSS chief's swadeshi call amid US tariffsDelivering his Vijayadashami address from the RSS headquarters in Nagpur, Mohan Bhagwat said that in an interconnected world, India's dependence on trading partners should not turn into helplessness and that the country must focus on indigenous production.

Salesman-in-chief? Asim Munir mocked at home over rock show with TrumpThe blowback indicates simmering discontent inside Pakistan over growing involvement of the military in diplomacy, which is primarily carried out by civilian leaders.

The curious case of Ladakh's 'pregnancy tourism'The concept of pregnancy tourism takes a complete U-turn when you head deep into Ladakh's Aryan Valley, where the narrative around the phenomenon has little to do with a better life or social benefits. Here, the story is tangled up in myth, folklore, and a lingering obsession with "racial purity."

Kantara Chapter 1 review: Rishab Shetty's folklore saga is a spellbinding spectacle  Live UpdatesKantara Chapter 1 movie review: Director, writer, and actor Rishab Shetty's film, also starring Rukmini Vasanth and Jayaram, explores the man vs nature conflict and land rights, blending them with divinity, folklore, myth, and faith. The film is a brilliant cinematic showcase.
Was Mahatma Gandhi anti-science?He criticised science that prioritised industrial and military gains over social justice and well-being. But there is more to him than meets the eye.

1st Test Live: Top order implodes against Bumrah and SirajIndia (IND) vs West Indies (WI), Live Score 1st Test: Mohammed Siraj and Jasprit Bumrah have sent the West Indies top-order home inside the first hour of play. Brandon King and Tagenarine Chanderpaul have got out playing very poor shots.

Government that ignores people faces anger: RSS chief's message after Nepal unrestSpeaking during the RSS's centenary celebrations, Mohan Bhagwat said that forces attempting to create Nepal-like disturbances in India were active inside as well as outside the country.

Maza aaya? Nurse's shocker after Uttarakhand woman gives birth on hospital floorA pregnant woman in Haridwar delivered her baby on the hospital floor after allegedly being denied admission. After the delivery, one of the nurses mocked her saying, 'Mazaa aayaa?'

Pope Leo's ice ritual, a veiled dig at Trump and a MAGA meltdownWithout naming anyone, history's first American pope spoke on climate change and slammed critics, just days after Donald Trump made false claims at the UN General Assembly (UNGA) about the "con job" of global warming.
Learn How Adobe Express Is Making Graphic Design Fun In ClassroomsThe Adobe Express app is available on any smart device or desktop computer.

Israel intercepts Gaza aid flotilla, releases video of Greta Thunberg in custodyThe Israeli foreign ministry shared a post on X saying Swedish climate activist Greta Thunberg and other passengers were "safe and healthy," alongside a video that appeared to show Thunberg with masked and armed Israeli personnel.

Maharashtra allows shops to stay open 24/7; bars, liquor outlets excludedMaharashtra government has allowed shops and establishments to operate 24/7, excluding liquor outlets. The move aims to boost business activity and ensure flexibility across the state.

Sunny Sanskari Ki review: Varun leads a shaky front in this lukewarm rom-comRelease Date:Thu Oct 02, 2025Sunny Sanskari Ki Tulsi Kumari movie review: Varun Dhawan and Shashank Khaitan reunite for 'Sunny Sanskari Ki Tulsi Kumari', a rom-com mixing classic Bollywood style with modern humour. The film entertains with witty dialogues but stumbles with a rushed climax and awkward scenes, says our review.

Deeply ironic to lecture on human rights: India slams Pakistan at UNHRCAt the 34th meeting of the UNHRC's 60th session in Geneva on Wednesday, Indian diplomat Mohammed Hussain called out Islamabad's hypocrisy in unusually sharp terms.

RSS: 100 years of service to the nationThe Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh (RSS) marks its centenary on Vijayadashami, celebrating a century of nation-building, social harmony, and service through its ideals of character-building and seva.

12 civilians killed in firing by Pak forces as violent protests paralyse POKThe unrest in Pakistan-Occupied Kashmir, which entered its third day, saw Pakistani security forces opening fire and using tear gas to disperse the protesters.

Married, but no connection: Reality of silent divorces in Indian homesSilent divorce is the reality of many Indian households. On paper and in society's eyes, couples remain married, but behind closed doors there is no emotional or physical connection. Rarely acknowledged, this situation often leaves people bitter, fuels mental health struggles, and has long-term consequences for children.

Two shooters of Goldy Brar gang arrested in Delhi, Munawar Faruqui was targetThe two shooters, acting on orders from gangsters Rohit Godara, Goldy Brar, and Virender Charan, had been plotting the murder of a social media influencer, reportedly Munawar Faruqui, and had conducted reconnaissance of their targets in Mumbai and Bengaluru.

Passenger jets collide at New York airport, video shows aircraft's wing detachedThe collision at LaGuardia Airport also damaged the nose of one of the planes. Significant casualties were avoided as the planes were taxiing at low speed.

Elon Musk becomes first person to hit $500 billion net worth, Forbes list showsElon Musk's net worth hit USD 499.5 billion on Wednesday, driven by Tesla's stock rebound and rising valuations of SpaceX and xAI, making him the first person to approach a half-trillion fortune.

Classical singer Pandit Chhannulal Mishra dies at 89Pandit Chhannulal Mishra, acclaimed Hindustani classical singer, died early Thursday in Mirzapur. He was 89 years old. Prime Minister Narendra Modi paid his last respects to the late singer on social media.

Stress, screens: Millennial employees face 70% spike in heart disease riskAccording to an analysis of over 30,000 employees, heart disease cases have risen by 40%, with chronic stress and demanding work schedules identified as major contributors.
Living like a MahatmaMahatma Gandhi developed a certain level of relentless commitment to a cause and rose like a colossus. The man went on to move millions of people.

I thought it was over: Jimmy Kimmel opens up about being taken off airSpeaking on The Late Show with Stephen Colbert on Tuesday night, Kimmel recounted learning about the suspension just 90 minutes before taping was scheduled to begin.

sports.headline: Kuldeep Yadav returns to India's Test side after almost a year vs West Indies Kuldeep Yadav's extended absence from India's Test side ended on Thursday, with the left-arm wrist-spinner named in the playing XI for the opening match of the two-Test series against West Indies at Ahmedabad's Narendra Modi Stadium.

No rest for Bumrah as India pacer plays 1st Test days after Asia Cup final India vs West Indies, 1st Test: Just days after leading India to their Asia Cup 2025 triumph over Pakistan, Jasprit Bumrah was back in action in the first Test against West Indies.

Hansi Flick blames fatigue after PSG down Barcelona 2-1 in Champions League Barcelona coach Hansi Flick has complained about fatigue after his team fell to a 1-2 defeat against PSG in the Champions League. Barcelona were dominated in the second half by a second string PSG side.

1st Test Live: Top order implodes against Bumrah and Siraj India (IND) vs West Indies (WI), Live Score 1st Test: Mohammed Siraj and Jasprit Bumrah have sent the West Indies top-order home inside the first hour of play. Brandon King and Tagenarine Chanderpaul have got out playing very poor shots.

Why did Ravichandran Ashwin go unsold in ILT20 auction: Explained Ravichandran Ashwin went unsold in the ILT20 auction, surprising many cricket fans and experts. His decision to prioritise the Big Bash League suggests strategic planning amid scheduling conflicts.

IND vs WI: Is India's spin attack prepared for life after R Ashwin? India are set to embark on a new era at home as they face the West Indies in a two-Test series after the retirement of Ravichandran Ashwin. His absence has left a big void, but the series presents an opportunity for a new generation of spinners to rise and restore India's home dominance.

In Pant's absence, Dhruv Jurel given a chance to prove he's not just a backup keeper In the absence of Rishabh Pant, Dhruv Jurel comes in red-hot form and has an opportunity to prove that there is more to his game than just being a backup-keeper in the Test team.

Can the new-look West Indies trouble Shubman Gill's India? Roston Chase's West Indies arrives in India for a two-match Test series at a time when India, under Shubman Gill, appear more vulnerable at home than they have in years. But do the Caribbean visitors have the firepower to take advantage?

I'd throw it all away to win: Sophie Devine reflects on bittersweet loss vs Australia Sophie Devine scored a heroic 111 runs in New Zealand's ICC Women's World Cup opener against Australia. Despite her effort, New Zealand fell short chasing 327, highlighting the challenge posed by the defending champions.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
